page.title: 02Churnet valley & Consall .
page.content: Tourism is in this area is because of the nearness to Alton Towers and the beauty of the Churnet valley. The river Churnet runs through Cheddleton, Froghall and Oakamoor and joins with the Cauldon canal at Consall Forge. The canal was used for transporting limestone, ironore and wood for the iron industry which was important in the valley in the 16th and 17th centuries. Later in the 19th century a railway was also built to aid transport but this is no longer used. Today the canal is used for pleasure with barge holidays and day trips being very popular the success of these and the natural beauty of Consall forge has allowed the Black Lion pub to remain popular despite the fact it has no main public access road.
